thread.title: Flyers practice: Brayden Schenn returns to right wing
thread.title_full: Flyers practice: Brayden Schenn returns to right wing | NJ.com

author: Randy Miller | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Flyers practice: Brayden Schenn returns to right wing
text:
VOORHEES — Brayden Schenn looked as good as he has in a Flyers uniform late last season playing right wing. He was back there for a portion of Monday's practice despite leading the team in scoring with three points in four games playing right wing.
Flyers coach Dave Hakstol did a lot of experimenting with his third line during Monday's practice ... so much that it's hard to tell for sure who will play where in Tuesday night's 7:30 p.m. home game against the Dallas Stars.
ALSO: 5 Flyers who need to pick up game: Simmonds not getting many chances
Hakstol rotated four players in and out on the line — Scott Laughton, Sam Gagner , Schenn and R.J. Umberger, the latter of whom is healthy after missing two games with an upper-body injury.
Gagner and Schenn each got looks at center and both wing positions.
As practice went on, Hakstol most often was using Laughton at center with Schenn at left wing and Gagner on the right wing.
The Flyers won their last two games with Gagner and Schenn flip-flopped on the line with Laughton at center.
Schenn switched from left wing to right wing late last season after Wayne Simmonds broke his leg, then finished with four goals and eight points in seven games.
Meantime, it's looking like Umberger will sit as a healthy scratch for Tuesday's game, which will the Flyers' first in six days.
Umberger skated on the fourth line during Friday and Sunday's practices, which led to speculation that right wing would sit out Tuesday's game.
Meantime, it appears Steve Mason will return in goal after missing two games for a personal issue.
The giveaway?
Mason spent most of practice in the goal furthest from the Flyers' dressing room, the one he's always in when he's starting.
Here is the lineup the Flyers used in practice:
FORWARD LINES
Green jerseys: Michael Raffl, Claude Giroux, Jakub Voracek.
Red jerseys: Matt Read, Sean Couturier, Wayne Simmonds.
White jerseys: Brayden Schenn, Scott Laughton, Sam Gagner, R.J. Umberger.
Gray jerseys: Chris VandeVelde, Pierre-Edouard Bellemare, Ryan White, Vinny Lecavalier.
DEFENSE PAIRS
Nick Schultz, Mark Streit
Michael Del Zotto, Brandon Manning
Evgeny Medvedev, Radko Gudas
(Extra: Luke Schenn)
